definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized

sentences.english: I specialize in conversational English and can be particular with grammar and writing.
sentences.chinese: 我专攻英文会话，文法与写作。

sentences.english: Besides, you shall be good at communication so that people understand your thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 术业有专攻并善于合理表达自己想法并沟通。

sentences.english: Each of us has had to specialize and focus on one aspect of the project.
sentences.chinese: 我们每个人分工合作，专攻项目的一个方面。

sentences.english: Being a communication graduate, I specialize in Business English and Conversational English.
sentences.chinese: 当一个大学毕业生，我专攻商用英文以及会话英文。

sentences.english: ZeroG Wireless is a semiconductor company that's focused on building low-power wireless chips.
sentences.chinese: 是一家专攻小功耗无线芯片的半导体公司。

sentences.english: We are an OEM manufacturer and we want to start selling our own branded products.
sentences.chinese: 我们专攻代工制造，正准备开始销售自有品牌产品。

sentences.english: Wen Road have been, industry specializing in surgery, so it.
sentences.chinese: 闻道有先后，术业有专攻，如是而已。

sentences.english: The company specializes in making silicon crystal wafers to be used in photovoltaic cells.
sentences.chinese: 该公司专攻用于光伏电池的硅晶片。

sentences.english: Some companies specialized in massively parallel computing.
sentences.chinese: 一些公司专攻大规模的并行计算。

sentences.english: I am an attorney specializing in civil education and I practice here in San Francisco.
sentences.chinese: 我是一名专攻民法教育的律师，在旧金山执业。

sentences.english: Initially, Xie Wenjun's soccer practice, specializing in goal.
sentences.chinese: 最初，谢文骏练习的是足球，专攻守门员。

sentences.english: Mr. Lee said he would major in history and he means business.
sentences.chinese: 李先生说他要专攻历史，他是决心认真干的。

sentences.english: This product is currently hot sold in Japan for man and woman market.
sentences.chinese: 目前在日本火辣辣热卖中之专攻男女市场产品。

sentences.english: "Post-bachelor" students will specialize in applied research and development projects.
sentences.chinese: “学士后”学生专攻应用研究和发展项目。

sentences.english: London College of Art which obviously will specialise in fashion.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦艺术学院，这显然是专攻时装的。

definition: main assault/to focus on/to specialize in/to major in
to skim (through a book)/to read cursorily/to dip into
to be good at/to be expert in
switch to a job one was not trained for
to be good at sth/one's forte
to be proficient in/to master (a subject)
level of mastery (of a skill or area of knowledge)/(archaic) to pay a visit to sb
to undertake advanced studies/to take a refresher course
